item.title: Apple Butter Cafe at 32-34 Monmouth St, London, 18th June
item.description:
Apple Butter Cafe at 32-34 Monmouth St, London WC2H 9HA puts out queue barriers obstructing the pavement. These are clearly beyond their boundary as marked by the studs on the pavement in front of the shop. There are no queues in the morning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tower Court, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nearly hit by a car, 18th June
item.description:
This car mounted the pavement and nearly hit me. The driver said I should have moved as I saw him coming, he also added, you're not blind. As a parent if a blind child, I found this all a bit frustrating. The parking in this area is getting beyond a joke now. Enfield Council need to do so thing about it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hertford Road, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Put big posters on the walls on rubbish room outside "NO FLYTIPPING" AND "RESIDENTS ONLY ", 18th June
item.description:
Can you ask street cleaning team to clean the streets every single day because the streets are getting very dirty constantly and it is very uncomfortable and actually extremely disgusting to have such dirty and messy streets. Please do a compain informing all the residents of Southwark council to be concerned and respectful towards other people who live in this borough and not to dirty and not to cause mess all over the place.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Watts Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish along Tetty Way, 18th June
item.description:
There is rubbish, broken glass and broken plastic along Tetty Way. Please can this be removed asap before it damages a cars tyre or a child starts playing with the glass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tetty Way, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smashed up pavements between 2 - 4 Blenheim Road, 18th June
item.description:
The paving slabs outside of 2-4 Blenheim Road are smashed to pieces. The paving slabs are up in the air and dipping down and are a trip hazard. Please can this be looked into asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Blenheim Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins with rubbish, 18th June
item.description:
There’s rubbish accumulating here. Are these bins meant to be here? They look brand new but they’re on the pavement and unlabelled. It wouldn’t be a bad idea to have bins here to collect all the fly tipping that happens here, but I doubt it’s that logical!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Franklin Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
